intro: Polyadenia grandis, commonly known as the great-leaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its twining vines and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in the morning, giving it its common name. Its leaves are large, heart-shaped, and often have a velvety texture. Polyadenia grandis is often found in moist, open habitats such as woodlands and along stream banks.
